Recommended Exercises.exercise: Walking: A great way to stay active without putting too much strain on your body.
Swimming: Provides a full-body workout while being gentle on the joints.
Prenatal Yoga: Helps in flexibility, breathing, and relaxation. Focus on gentle poses.
Pelvic Floor Exercises (Kegels): Strengthens the pelvic floor muscles, which can help during labor and recovery.
Light Strength Training: Use light weights or resistance bands to maintain muscle tone. Avoid heavy lifting.

Exercises to Avoid.exercise: High-impact activities like running or jumping.
Exercises that involve lying flat on your back for extended periods.
Contact sports or activities with a risk of falling, like horseback riding or skiing.

Recommended Yoga Poses.pose: Cat-Cow Pose (Marjaryasana-Bitilasana): Stretches the spine, relieves back tension, and improves flexibility.
Mountain Pose (Tadasana): Improves posture and balance.
Tree Pose (Vrikshasana): Enhances balance and strengthens legs.
Seated Forward Bend (Paschimottanasana): Stretches the hamstrings and lower back.
Childâ€™s Pose (Balasana): Provides gentle relaxation and stretches the hips, thighs, and back.

Recommended Exercises.exercise: Walking: Continue as a low-impact cardiovascular activity.
Swimming and Water Aerobics: These activities provide buoyancy, reducing the strain on your joints and ligaments.
Prenatal Yoga: Focus on poses that support your changing body and balance.
Pelvic Floor Exercises: Continue to strengthen the pelvic muscles.
Modified Pilates: Helps improve core strength and posture. Avoid exercises that require lying flat on your back for too long.

Exercises to Avoid.exercise: Lying on your back for extended periods (as it can reduce blood flow to the baby).
Activities that involve balancing, as your center of gravity changes.

Recommended Yoga Poses.pose: Warrior II Pose (Virabhadrasana II): Strengthens the legs, opens the hips, and improves stamina.
Triangle Pose (Trikonasana): Stretches the sides of the body, improves balance.
Butterfly Pose (Baddha Konasana): Opens the hips and inner thighs, and promotes relaxation.
Seated Wide-Legged Forward Bend (Upavistha Konasana): Stretches the hamstrings, groin, and back.

Poses to Avoid.pose: Lying flat on your back for long periods.
Inversions and poses that involve balance if you feel unsteady.

Recommended Exercises.exercise: Walking: Gentle walks help keep you active without overexerting yourself.
Swimming and Water Aerobics: Reduces swelling and supports the weight of the baby, providing relief.
Prenatal Yoga: Focus on relaxation, breathing techniques, and gentle stretching.
Pelvic Floor Exercises: Continue to practice Kegels to prepare for labor and postpartum recovery.
Squats and Gentle Stretching: Helps in strengthening the lower body muscles and maintaining flexibility.

Exercises to Avoid.exercise: Exercises that involve lying flat on your back or stomach.
High-impact exercises or activities with a high risk of falling.
Exercises that cause excessive fatigue or discomfort.

Recommended Yoga Poses.pose: Goddess Pose (Utkata Konasana): Strengthens the lower body, opens the hips, and prepares for labor.
Supported Squat (Malasana): Opens the hips and strengthens the lower body, helps in preparing for labor.
Side-Lying Pose (Anantasana): Stretches the sides of the body and relieves lower back tension.
Breathing Exercises (Pranayama): Focuses on deep breathing, calming the mind, and preparing for labor.

Poses to Avoid.pose: Any pose that puts pressure on the abdomen.
Inversions and balance poses without support.
Lying flat on your back for extended periods.

General Tips.tip: Use Props: Use blocks, straps, or blankets for additional support.
Avoid Overstretching: Your body produces relaxin, which loosens joints and ligaments, so be cautious not to overstretch.
Focus on Breathing: Emphasize deep, slow, and controlled breathing throughout your practice.
Stay Hydrated: Drink plenty of water before, during, and after exercise.
Listen to Your Body: If you feel tired or uncomfortable, take a break or stop the exercise.
Avoid Overheating: Exercise in a cool, well-ventilated area, especially in hot weather.
Wear Comfortable Clothing: Opt for breathable, loose-fitting clothes and supportive footwear.
